description: When acute renal failure occurs in the background of pre-existing chronic kidney disease.
name: Acute-on-Chronic Renal Failure

description: A sudden episode of kidney failure or kidney damage that happens within a few hours or a few days.
name: Acute Kidney Injury

description: A kidney disorder involving damage to and death of the tubular epithelial cells that form the renal tubules of the kidneys.
name: Acute Tubular Necrosis

description: Kidney damage that occurs slowly over many years.
name: Chronic Kidney Disease

description: The term used to describe the pathophysiological changes that occur in the vascular and skeletal system in association with CKD.
name: Chronic Kidney Disease Mineral Bone Disorder

description: The final stage of chronic kidney disease where the kidneys are not functioning well enough to meet the needs of daily life.
name: Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 5

description: Impaired kidney function in which the kidneys fail to adequately filter metabolic wastes from the blood.
name: Kidney Failure
